item.description:
This hike is on! Dress appropriately for a little breeze, and bring food and drink to snack on.  I will be at the kayak/canoe launch across the street from the Campground @9:45 in a silver Toyota Corolla with obscenities scratched into it (don't ask). Hope to see you all there.  978 821-9489 if you need to reach me.

 

Let's spend some nice time walking the edge of Long Pond following mostly flat type terrain before we make our way up alongside Spirit Falls. The climb up (notice I didn't say walk) along the falls is rather strenuous, but luckily only about a quarter mile. From there we will walk along mostly flat terrain to Jacobs Ladder. As I have never been to the actual Jacobs Ladder, this part of the hike will be an adventure!
If we feel up to it we can return the same way with a side trip to "the Ledges ". This adds about a mile to the 4 mile hike, give or take.

DIRECTIONS
In Massachusetts, take Route 2 to exit 17. Follow Route 32 North approximately 6 miles.
From New Hampshire, follow Route 32 south about 8 miles from the intersection of Route 119 in Richmond.
Route 32, also called Athol-Richmond Road, goes right over Tully Dam. The Recreation Area is at the north end of the dam. The Park Office is just south of the dam.
To get to the Campground, take Doane Hill Road off of Route 32 north of the dam. Travel about 3/4 mile and the Campground will be on your right, just before the Tully River.
WE WILL BE PARKING JUST PAST THE CAMPGROUND BUT ON THE OPPOSITE SIDE OF THE ROAD. This is a canoe/kayak launching area, but there is plenty of room.
With rest stops and time to stand with our mouths agape admiring the views, this should take 3-4 hours. I am attending a Halloween party the night before, so I may walk a bit slower than normal!

group.name: Northern Central MA, Southern NH Hiking Group

item.name: Explore Long Pond, Spirit Falls, and Jacobs Ladder in Royalston MA
